intro: Cissampelos dinklagei, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing vine native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces woody, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
